result.execSummary:
The defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Deronti (NMN) Rogers Jr.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. state indicates resolution. Defendant will plead to sole count. 90 days jail, $3488 fine inclusive, 48 month revocation and IID, assessment and safety plan, 57 days credit.
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads guilty. Court informs defendant of rights given up by his plea. Defendant understands. Court finds defendant understands proceedings and finds waiver is made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. Court accepts defendants plea and finds plea is made freely, knowingly and voluntarily. Stipulation to a factual basis. Court finds defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered.
Court orders 90 days jail, 57 days credit, $3488 fine inclusive, assessment and safety plan, 48 month license revocation, IID on every vehicle to begin with revocation for 48 months.
RTS/UTF
Plea hearing on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:48 AM Defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Deronti (NMN) Rogers Jr.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Court accepts plea.
Motion hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Pre-trial conference on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:48 PM Defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers in custody.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Craker filed written motion in case and is concerned about lab results being so backed up defendant would be in pretrial incarceration for quite some time. Court questions if any holds. State is opposed to bail modification and requests it be set higher. Defendant has been bound over and has 15 fta in 3-4 years. Criminal history is out of Minnesota mainly and not local Minnesota counties. State reviews defendant's failures to appear and Minnesota criminal record. Attorney Craker does not find failures to appear to be accurate. Court reviews factors in determining bail and possible penalties of charges. Court denies bail modification.
Exhibit 1

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

03:27 PM Defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Deronti (NMN) Rogers in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Craker received complaint waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $5,000 cash bail and conditions of no operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license.  No use or possession of alcohol. Defendant has an open case with a signature bond. Defendant has two failures to appear in prior Douglas Co case. Defendant has several convictions out of Minnesota with several failures to appear in those cases. Attorney Craker argues against cash bail and questions whether he is on a probation hold or not. Defendant has family local and unable to post. Court asks for clarification of family ties. Attorney Craker states defendant has lived in area for last 3 years. State notes 2021 Minnesota case lists St. Cloud address. Attorney Craker states addresses most likely just didn't get updated. Court orders $3,000 cash bail and conditions of no operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. State clarified it should have been no drugs and not no alcohol.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
